Package org.kj.blackjack.player

Interface Player

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPlayer

    public interface Player
    Player of blackjack game. Each player has a name and hand.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addCard​(int val)
      Adds the specified card to the Player's hand.
      void displayAfterGame​()
      Displays information after game.
      void displayDuringGame​()
      Displays information during the game.
      int handSize​()
      Returns the hand size (number of cards the Player is holding).
      java.lang.String handToString​()
      Returns the hand as a String.
      java.lang.String name​()
      Returns the player's name
      Action playTurn​(int opponentHandSize)
      Returns either Action.HIT or Action.STAND.
      void setHand​(java.util.Collection<java.lang.Integer> hand)
      Sets the player's hand to the specified Collection of Integers (cards).
      int sum​()
      Sums the values of all the cards the player has in their hand.

    • Method Detail

      • setHand

        void setHand​(java.util.Collection<java.lang.Integer> hand)
        Sets the player's hand to the specified Collection of Integers (cards).
        Parameters:
        hand - the Integers (cards) the player is holding

      • addCard

        void addCard​(int val)
        Adds the specified card to the Player's hand.
        Parameters:
        val - the value of the card to add

      • sum

        int sum​()
        Sums the values of all the cards the player has in their hand.
        Returns:
        the sum

      • handSize

        int handSize​()
        Returns the hand size (number of cards the Player is holding).
        Returns:
        the hand size

      • name

        java.lang.String name​()
        Returns the player's name
        Returns:
        the name

      • handToString

        java.lang.String handToString​()
        Returns the hand as a String. See Collection
        Returns:
        string representation of hand

      • playTurn

        Action playTurn​(int opponentHandSize)
        Returns either Action.HIT or Action.STAND. How the player chooses one or the other is dependent on implementation.
        Parameters:
        opponentHandSize - number of cards opponent has
        Returns:
        Action.HIT or Action.STAND

      • displayDuringGame

        void displayDuringGame​()
        Displays information during the game. This display should show only information that is essential for the current state of the game.

      • displayAfterGame

        void displayAfterGame​()
        Displays information after game. This should show the player's name and hand.
